passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Richard Branson is the founder of the Virgin Group. • The Virgin Group consists of more than 400 companies. • Branson started his first business, a magazine called Student, at the age of 16. • In 2004, Branson founded Virgin Galactic, a space tourism company.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to highlight Richard Branson's entrepreneurial spirit?

choices.A: Richard Branson, the founder of the Virgin Group, started his first business at the age of 16.
choices.B: Richard Branson demonstrated his entrepreneurial spirit by founding his first business at 16 and later creating the Virgin Group with over 400 companies.
choices.C: The Virgin Group, founded by Richard Branson, consists of more than 400 companies.
choices.D: In 2004, Richard Branson founded Virgin Galactic, a space tourism company.

explanation: B: 'Richard Branson demonstrated his entrepreneurial spirit by founding his first business at 16 and later creating the Virgin Group with over 400 companies.' is the correct answer because it highlights both his early start in business and the vast scope of his current ventures.
distractor_explanation: 'Richard Branson, the founder of the Virgin Group, started his first business at the age of 16.' is incorrect because it only focuses on his first business.
'The Virgin Group, founded by Richard Branson, consists of more than 400 companies.' is incorrect because it only mentions the Virgin Group, not his initial entrepreneurial endeavor.
'In 2004, Richard Branson founded Virgin Galactic, a space tourism company.' is incorrect because it only highlights one of his ventures, not his overall entrepreneurial spirit.
